text: hello and welcome to the AWS innovate online conference the topic I am
presenting today will help you deliver a great mobile experience that will wow your customers this session is titled
going mobile in minutes with AWS mobility my name is Anand Eyre and I'm an
enterprise Solutions Architect at Amazon Internet services Private Limited and I'm based out of Mumbai
India in my prior roles as an application developer software engineer and Technical Architect
I have had the opportunity to work with customers across multiple industries such as banking financial services
retail and manufacturing to name a few in this session I will talk about
developing and deploying highly engaging mobile apps using AWS mobile services
mobile apps have been gaining popularity worldwide contributing to the increase
in data usage with many new apps being released every day however it is
interesting to note only the top view account for the bulk of the downloads my
goal is by the end of this presentation you will have an understanding of the tools and techniques to build a standout
mobile app on the AWS platform this presentation is structured in three
parts first I will walk you through the various features of developing a mobile
app using the AWS mobile hub second we will cover the continuous and iterative
testing and delivery tools such as AWS device farm and finally the third and
the most important piece measuring the effectiveness of your mobile app using
AWS mobile analytics which completes the feedback loop giving you the critical
insight to prioritize features and functions of your mobile app so before
we dive straight into the topic let's put some context around it mobile app development has experienced tremendous
growth the market continues to grow with four million plus apps and app revenue
estimated to be a hundred billion dollars by 2020 the opportunity is huge last year alone
there were 75 billion app downloads but the competition is fierce a very small
percentage of apps succeed and an even smaller percentage are big hits also
developing apps is a big investment on average AB build times are 18 weeks plus
there is ongoing investment in maintaining and growing the usage of an app as a result many apps never get to
see the light of the day of their second version many factors can help hinder
success including app quality time to market scalability and reliability and
perhaps most importantly the unique features of the app therefore it is
imperative for mobile app developers to differentiate their apps and constantly
innovate to add new features to attract new users and retain existing ones while
continuing to cater to the different mobile devices and mobile platforms adding to this as the app market
intensifies developers need to ensure that they go to market faster and create
increasingly rich user experiences while keeping the cost of experimentation low
and for many developers balancing these elements is a critical trade-off for
success adding more features can get you more users but if users are seeing app
crashes or slow response times the abandonment rate is going to be high if
you invest time and money in testing on real devices to improve app quality the
development time for the app could increase and the app releases could be delayed and after you launch your app
knowing what users are doing with it is important if you invest time in the
wrong features version 2 of your app may not meet user expectations AWS mobile
services are designed to help developers to effectively navigate these challenges here are just a few examples of
mobile apps built on AWS I'll highlight a few of these tinder has seen
exponential growth since their launch in 2012 1.8 billion swipes per day with 1.2
million matches per day and 7 petabytes data transfer per month all this
translates to storage of 2 plus billion messages per month in Amazon DynamoDB
and 10 plus billion events per day stored in Amazon redshift Azorean is a
device insurance company with 200 million plus customers they collect device related data and provide
recommendations for how the user can optimize their device usage they wanted
to onboard users to their app and they used Amazon kognito user pools to store
user credentials and identify user that's completely avoiding the hassles
of scaling and securing a homegrown identity and authentication system so
what exactly is AWS mobile hub AWS mobile hub simplifies the process of
building testing and monitoring mobile applications that make use of one or
more AWS services it can help you skip the front-end and back-end heavy lifting
of manually creating cloud service configurations and integrating them into your client the mobile app features
supported includes user authentication data storage back-end logic push
notifications content delivery and analytics all from a single integrated
console after you build your app AWS mobile hub gives you easy access to
testing on real devices as well as analytics dashboards to track usage of
your app there is no charge for mobile hub you only pay for the AWS services
used there are five main areas that the AWS mobile hub focuses on based on key
phases of mobile app's lifecycle develop test deploy measure and engage we will
look at these in more detail as we go through the presentation and oh by the
way all of these while providing the scalability flexibility and security
that your app needs uws makes it easy to scale up and down as your needs grow or
spike you have the flexibility to use the languages and tools that best fit
your needs if your usage spikes one month and returns to normal the next month no problem you scale up and pay
for the extra resources and return to normal usage cloud security is a double
aces highest priority the a SS infrastructure puts strong safeguards in place to help protect
customers privacy all data is stored in highly secure AWS data centers AWS
manages dozens of compliance programs in its infrastructure no matter the size of
your business the AWS infrastructure is designed to keep data safe a SS provides
a number of services to enable mobile developers to create high-quality scalable and reliable apps the mobile
services fall in three main categories that we will cover in the remainder of this presentation in the develop phase
our goal is to make it quick and easy for you to leverage and incorporate a
range of proven AWS services in your apps with Amazon Cognito you can add
user signup and sign-in flows with support from multi-factor authentication to your apps you can also authenticate
users through social identity providers such as Facebook Twitter and Google Plus
Amazon Cognito and Amazon s3 enable you to store and sync user data such as user
profiles settings or game progress or store use of files like photos creating
a mobile backend without provisioning or managing servers is easy with AWS lambda
and Amazon API gateway just a Floria code and invoke it using api's from your
mobile app we will take care of everything required to run and scale your code every app needs a data store
and you can use Amazon DynamoDB to store and query your app data using a fully
managed cloud database that provides consistent and fast service at any scale
for enhanced user experience you can store app assets like media files in the
cloud and download and cache them in your app you can use a CDN to distribute
content to your users with low latency and high transfer speeds with Amazon s3
and Amazon CloudFront you can engage with users by sending
push notifications either to individuals or groups of users you can send just a
few messages or scaled to billions of messages a day with Amazon simple
notification service finally with Amazon pin point you can run targeted campaigns
to drive user engagement in mobile apps the slide shows AWS mobile hub console
with various features that a developer chooses to integrate in his or her app
after configuring the features AWS Mobile hub will create the necessary glue code in the project allowing the
developer to focus on building business logic for the app Amazon Cognito
federated identities enables you to create unique identities for your users
and authenticate them with identity providers with an identity you can
obtain temporary limited privileged AWS credentials to synchronize data with
Amazon Cognito sync or directly access other AM AWS services Amazon Cognito
identity supports public identity providers like Amazon Facebook Google
and sam'l identity providers as well as unauthenticated identities
Amazon simple storage service Amazon s3 provides secure durable highly scalable
object storage in the cloud using the AWS Mobile SDK you can directly access
Amazon s3 from your mobile app the AWS Mobile SDK allows you to consume the
Amazon s3 service in your mobile application why are the s3 transfer
utility the fully functional iOS sample app generated by the mobile hub includes
AWS Mobile SDK for iOS s3 transfer utility and all the helper code for
running the demo app amazon SNS is a publish/subscribe based notification
service that is used by several leading brands and startups to send billions of
mobile push notifications across iOS android windows fire hose and Baidu and
enterprise messages also every day Amazon SNS scales as your needs grow and
offers usage-based pricing lastly with Amazon pinpoint you can understand user
behavior define which users to target determine which messages to send
scheduled the best time to deliver the messages and then track the results of
your campaign let's look at various authentication options you can integrate in your mobile app along with existing
Facebook and Google sign-in options you can mix and match these with signing
providers such as email and password and sam'l identity Federation options to set
up the authentication flow that your app needs in minutes under the hood AWS
mobile hub provisions and configures all required AWS services on your behalf
that includes Amazon kognito for authentication AWS Identity and Access
Management for access authorization and services like DynamoDB s3 buckets
as well AWS mobile hub also uses the options you select to dynamically
generate working sign up sign in and password recovery flow code in a
QuickStart app you can download and use directly or customized for your app the
email and password option provisions a user directory called a user pool the
user pool stores user identities and profile attributes and is the source of
authentication when your users sign into your app mobile hub uses Amazon Cognito
user pools to manage and validate user identities you can combine the email and
password option in addition to the Facebook and Google sign-in options and allow you allow your users to choose the
account they prefer to sign into your app you can also use sam'l Federation
option to authenticate users through your own sam'l identity provider and provide secure access to AWS resources
such as Amazon s3 and Amazon DynamoDB through the Amazon Cognito console your
identity provider must support sam'l 2.0 to federate with AWS we are seeing an
increasing number of developers take on the challenges of enterprise mobility they want to build b2c business to
consumer and B to e business to employee applications that are as powerful
flexible and secure as their existing desktop they want to use that existing
corporate user territories and they want to tap into existing CRM sales
management accounting and customer service tools new SAS integration
features will be of special interest to developers who are building these types of apps SAS connectors make it easy to
securely access data in third-party enterprise SAS applications from your mobile apps AWS mobile hub now provides
built-in SAS application connectors that access the most commonly used objects for example accounts contacts
leads in Salesforce Microsoft Dynamics Marquis de HubSpot Zendesk and
QuickBooks SAS connectors also let your applications perform queries to retrieve
all the custom objects available in these applications each SAS connector runs as an AWS lambda micro service and
is exposed as a REST API through Amazon API gateway you can integrate your
applications with SAS connectors using the REST API directly or via iOS and
Android SDKs that are generated by the mobile hub accessing the SAS application
data through a connector gives your mobile app a central point for auditing
and metering all calls enabling caching and throttling and performance testing
in addition SAS connectors normalize the underlying SAS api's providing you a
consistent object view within categories such as CRM marketing automation and
customer support consistent paging and filtering behaviors and consistent
documentation which is using the swagger to doddle API definition format
additionally each connector has an accompanying QuickStart mobile app to
guide you through the authenticating users within the SAS provider and begin
using the connector you can download the QuickStart app from the integrate tab in
your AWS mobile hub project and use the code as a boilerplate for your app user
engagement is an area of particular interest to developers the amazon lacks
integration in AWS mobile hub enables developers to take advantage of powerful
automatic speech recognition and natural language understanding capabilities that
power Alexa to create engaging speech and text-based conversational BOTS in
your app Amazon Lex understands the intent behind the input
and fulfills the user intent by invoking appropriate response you can create
engaging conversational experiences for common app scenarios such as booking
tickets ordering products creating cases with customer support querying an
internal ID helpdesk system and more Amazon Lex is designed to let you go get
going quickly you start out by designing your conversation in the Lex console
providing Lex with some sample phrases that I used to build a natural language
model then you publish your Amazon Lex bot and let it process text or voice
conversations with your users and as on Lex is a fully managed service so you
don't need to spend time setting up managing or scaling any infrastructure
your chat bot can connect with facebook Messenger slack Twilio on the AWS site
it works with AWS Lambda AWS Mobile hub and Amazon Cloud watch your code can
make use of Amazon DynamoDB Amazon Cognito and other services putting it
all together you now have access to all of the moving parts needed to build
fully integrated solutions that start at the mobile app and go all the way to the
fulfillment logic let's take a quick look at the principle amazon lacks concepts a bot contains all the
components of a conversation and intent represents a goal that the bots user
wants to achieve example buying a plane ticket scheduling an appointment or
getting a weather forecast and so on and so forth an utterance is a spoken-- or
pipe phrase that invokes an intent I want to book a hotel or I want to order
flowers are two simple utterances each slot is a piece of data that the
user must supply in order to fulfill the intent slots are typed travel what could
have slots for cities States or airports a prompt is a question that asks the
user to supply some data for that slot that is needed to fulfill an intent
fulfillment is the business logic that carries the users intent Lex supports
the use of lambda functions for fulfillment BOTS intents and slots are
urgent so that you can draw clear lines between development testing staging and
production in a multi developer environment you can create multiple aliases for each of your BOTS and map
them to specific versions of the components AWS mobile hub makes it easy
to add conversational interfaces to your mobile app when you select
conversational BOTS mobile hub adds a fully functional messaging screen to the
quick startup the QuickStart app uses Amazon Lex Mobile SDK to acquire speech
and text inputs from the app and then sends these to Amazon legs for further
processing Amazon legs is securely configured with access control policies
making it easy to use with AWS mobile hub features such as Cynon SAS
connectors and dynamo DB once you have selected the desired features for your app AWS mobile hub will give you an
option to download the source code to be imported into Android studio or Xcode
project the project now uses your AWS resources and includes helper code along
with detailed into integration instructions as well now that we have completed the development phase we are
ready to test and deploy our application let's look at the second phase of the
mobile application lifecycle application quality is is a very important differentiator in an
increasingly competitive app market 45% of consumers will uninstall an app when
it crashes and 32% go to a competitor's solution you need to make sure that the
people that download your app are happy and engaged whether they discovered your
app in the market or are coming from a competitor while emulators and
simulators are helpful for small routine unit tests at the end of the day your
users are running your app on a variety of phones and tablets we built AWS
device form to make mobile application testing easy AWS device form enables you
to improve the quality of your app by testing it on real physical phones and
tablets in the AWS cloud AWS maintains a growing collection of hundreds of
different devices in AWS data centers these devices are made available 24/7
for your testing needs whether you are running automated tests in a highly parallel way or debugging an issue
reported by one of your customers customers like school messenger and I
Bebo utilized device farm to test new functionality through remote access this
allows them to install their app and then manually interact with the device through the browser as if the device was
sitting on their desk once the new functionality is stable the test can be automated and then run in parallel on
hundreds of different devices generating actionable reports with video
screenshots performance data and logs to get to the root cause of any issue they
don't discuss right before a new release data throughout their development process when a customer reports an issue
they can grab the exact device and reproduce the issue with the user in
real time testing on-demand is helpful but what about ensuring the integrity of
your bills on commit if if testing requires a structured approach and less friction you have
between your tests and your development the better that's why we have a RESTful
API that allows straightforward access to every aspect of device form by using
our CLI and SDKs testing and the test result analysis on device form can be
integrated in any tool or service that you use we have gone a step further and
built plug-ins for popular continuous integration solutions like Jenkins and
Gradle so you can set up seamless testing in in just a few minutes if you
don't have a CI environment you can go all in with the cloud and get started with Amazon code pipeline you will then
be able to kick tests off automatically whenever code is committed or a new
build is available catch issues quicker and make sure that your applications
that the applications you are deploying will delight your cussin your users we have covered why testing is important
when developing and deploying mobile applications but what about once your app is deployed you want to be sure that
our application is functioning correctly at all times and at all phases of the
development so a life cycle which includes after it's been published more
and more we see developers actively monitoring application health in an automated fashion for example at Etsy an
AWS device farm customer in addition to running tests automatically upon commit
there our nightly regressions and regular smoke tests to make sure that
their app is performing the way that customers expect rather than analyze
every single pass or fail they alert on groups of failures in a short window of
time to identify problems as they develop they build a dashboard that acts
as a heat map for clustering test failures the AWS device form api's make
this kind of continuous monitoring easy as you can see you can now debug
and test your apps on real phones and tablets the exact hardware your
customers are using continuously at all stages in the development lifecycle and
ensure that your app is going to function as your customers expect and you intend it's the moment of truth now
that your app is running in production you want to know how it is doing you
want to measure its effectiveness and increase its usage that's where we will
discuss the third phase of the mobile app lifecycle once your app is deployed
you want to generate insights in order to drive informed decisions first you
should be able to run analytics on usage retention and monetization second you
need flexibility in the app to instrument and run custom analytics and
finally analytics should be integrated across different channels be it mobile
or web or desktop Amazon pinpoint tracks
how your users interact with your app so you can monitor the impact of your campaigns pinpoint provides real-time
analytics with dashboards for analyzing user engagement monetization user
demographics custom events and funnels so you can understand how users engage
with your app you can analyze and understand your user data by drilling
down based on segments you have defined segmentation attributes or the time with
Amazon pinpoint you can define target segments from various data sources you
can identify segments from app user data collected by pin point you can build
custom segments from user data collected by other AWS services such as Amazon s3
and Amazon redshift you can also import user segments from third-party sources
such as Salesforce why is 3 once you define your segments Amazon
pinpoint lets you send targeted notifications with personalized messages
to each user in the segment based on custom attributes such as game level
favorite team and news preferences Amazon pinpoint can send push
notifications immediately at a time you define or add a recurring campaign by
scheduling campaigns you can optimize the push notifications to be delivered at a specific time across multiple time
zones you have seen how AWS mobile services platform enables developers to
develop apps quickly and easily with AWS services and manage infrastructure to
deliver high quality applications and engage users intelligently through
insights and multi-channel multi-platform messaging if after today
you are wanting to take your AWS now knowledge to the next level you have several options available to you to gain
more confidence and hands-on experience with AWS what are instructional videos
and explore the self-paced labs additionally you can attend our
instructor-led classes by qualified AWS instructors and learn how to design
deploy and operate highly available cost-effective and secure applications
on AWS and remember to validate your technical expertise with AWS
certification finally do take the time to provide feedback on today's event so
that we can improve the event experience for you in the future thank you for listening to me and hope you enjoy the
rest of the AWS innovate online conference Cheers and have a good day
[Music] you
